Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: dcam24
Reviews.Content: It took 4 rooms to finally get one where everything worked in the room.

Reviews.Title: “It's good in general, not good for the money, don't step outside”
Reviews.Author: travelladybug512
Reviews.Content: Pros: -The hotel itself is beautiful. Gorgeous lobby, gorgeous exterior, beautiful greenery in the pool area -The rooms are clean, woohoo! -There is a pool and a jacuzzi, and they're both completely usable -There is a small fitness center -Pool table in the lobby! -One restaurant, and a gift shop! Cons: -Clueless front desk staff, so unhelpful, didn't know anything about public transportation or nearby services. Also, just interacted weirdly: "You can look it up online but I know for a fact there's nothing available." Why would I look something up online that you know for a fact won't be helpful? Confused. -No explanation of services - I had no idea there was a rental car shop on site until they were closed for the weekend. I completely would've gone before they closed, had I known! -Paid internet in the room (not even wireless), $11.95 for 24 hours. Of course I just went for the free wifi in the lobby. But this is a Doubletree/Hilton - do you really need to nickel and dime your customers? -Police officers standing guard outside a room on our floor. "Is everything OK?" "Why, are you scared?" "Um, should I be?" "Nah" -Our room smelled like weed every time a room down the hall lit up. -The area outside the hotel is scary scary scary. Taxis are essential, and most of the drivers yell at you for using cards even though there's nothing nearby. More cons, but petty: -No spa in the hotel, just a hair salon run by 2 people who don't post a sign when they decide to leave the shop during their normal business hours. Back to unhelpful front desk - "Oh I don't know when they'll be back. It's not part of the hotel, so, I don't know." "Is there a spa nearby?" "Uh, yeah there's one at another hotel." "Is it walkable?" "About 20 minutes away by car." -All the clocks in the room were set to different times. Weird? -Lame fitness center -Insanely rude bartender at the restaurant. Wouldn't even hear my drink order until the third time I asked, at which point he yelled "ID" and walked away. I left my ID on the bar, and he came back and said "OK. What do you want." The food's not awesome, the prices are sky high, but what can you do when it's the only thing there. 3 stars for the clean hotel. If you're staying here one night before a cruise, it's totally fine. If you're staying here more than one night, find someplace nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a cruise leaving San Pedro,California”
Reviews.Author: mothermax
Reviews.Content: Nice location.Great view of the habor.We took our children and grandchildren on the cruise.We all drove there so we had three cars to park. This hotel has the park and cruise package which was great. Saved Grandparents about $90.00 per car plus a nice room the night before the cruise. Their dinning room had something for all ages. Our family was quite pleased. When we returned the hotel van was right there. Couldn't get better!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a night before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: azblueagave
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before cruising out of San Pedro. We drove from Arizona, so we chose the "park and cruise" package so we could park at the hotel, instead of paying to park at the cruise terminal for our 10 day cruise. If you don't get that package, I was told you couldn't park there. We didn't test it out, and just bought the package. One note- the price does go up as the date gets closer, so book early! They included a free drink per adult at the bar that night and free breakfast in the morning, which was great! They provided a free shuttle to the cruise terminal and it was prompt in dropping us off and picking us up, before/ after the cruise. The location is nice- right on the marina, but it is not walking distance to the downtown area. We did have a car, so it wasn't a big deal. We would definately stay here again if cruising out of San Pedro.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice!”
Reviews.Author: cnfour
Reviews.Content: Wish we had more than one night at this lovely hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was terrific ... we were upgraded to a room with a small balcony/deck area too bad it was raining. The pool area was nice and the pool was heated which is a definate plus near the ocean in CA. Breakfast in the dining area was good ... we opted for the buffet rather than off the menu. Dog friendly with plenty of safe, grassy areas for walks. Highly recommend if you have a reason to be on the south edge of Palos Verdes or San Pedro. Also ... looks like a great spot for a causal wedding ... although that was not our purpose for being in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property near the cruise port”
Reviews.Author: travlrover55
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed the property although I thought a little on the pricey side. Location is terrific for folks sailing out of San Pedro and is a great way to start off a cruise. Only downside is its isolation and the fact that you really need transportation to get off site. Gift shop is extremely small, which I thought a little surprising. Lovely lounge/lobby area and their handling of transportation to the ship was excellent. Would definitely use them again pre-cruise. We paid to upgrade to a room with marina view, probably wouldn't bother the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to leave your car if cruising from San Pedro”
Reviews.Author: Jumbuck06
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here as like last year we were joining a 2 week cruise to Hawaii. The staff seemed friendlier than last year and the shuttle service to/frpm the pier was spot on. The down side was the terrible service and food selection in the restaurant. We are loyal Hilton guests and would not rate this hotel better than the Hilton Garden Inn brand. Being able to leave the car for 14 days was the only reason we used this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for San Pedro sailings”
Reviews.Author: Francine N
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently - for the second time - before sailing out of San Pedro. While the hotel is kind of off the beaten path, we did walk about 2 miles to a CVS and mini mart. They offer free van rides to local establishments within a 5 mile range along with complimentary, very organized, transportation to and from the pier. It's a beautiful marina setting, nice lobby with free Internet and a wonderful restaurant. The owner of the mini mart told us he brings family here for dinner when they're visiting from Korea. They only downside - the rooms are in serious need of refurbishment. The chairs, drapes, bed-skirts, sheets and furniture show age and stains. The baths are as clean as they can get them for being old and patched up. I would definitely stay here again - the price is right, the staff is professional, warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “What'a great location”
Reviews.Author: Brace D
Reviews.Content: Love the location and it's always been worth the extra drive. It is a pleasure the walk around the marina morning or night. The staff is very courtious. Food is good. I like the breakfast. NIce lounge area a business center. The little shop inside is cool too and nice people are always in there, very helpful. Overall the hotel is a good spot for a skip and a jump location. I wouldn't stay longer than a day or two, but it's always nice to go back to. I've used it before a cruise. I like the beds and room service is cozy. I think the best is to really take your time and soak in the resort like atmosphere and walk the marina, have a cocktail, and play pool, or in the pool outside!

Reviews.Title: “cruise ship hotel”
Reviews.Author: jazzy123Ottawa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in feb 2012 excellent location for cruise ships. ask for room overlooking marina.bathrooms need major upgrade , otherwise okay . hotel offers free shuttle to town and cruise ships.

Reviews.Title: “fantasic location”
Reviews.Author: TaffWellington
Reviews.Content: If you love boats this is the ideal place to stay. Each morning I have walked around the marina and I have thoroughly enjoyed looking at all the different boats here. You need a car if you wish to look around Los Angeles area and be prepared for the enormous amount of traffic....

Reviews.Title: “Cute place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MsFirstClass
Reviews.Content: Warm cookies on arrival, helpful staff, lovely decorated hotel. Theres a view from the main lobby onto the Marina which is gorgeous and you can go for walks there too. We got a room with a view and so worth it!Get a Marina view! Free ample parking was also a ++++

Reviews.Title: “An excellent pre cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bruce B
Reviews.Content: Reserved a balcony room overlooking the marina, which turned out to an excellent choice. The room was large, clean, and very well appointed. The view was great, watched our cruise ship arrive down the main channel. The staff was very friendly, and helpful. The shuttle service was great, in fact because he was not busy the driver took us to the Queen Mary one morning, which I think is farther than they usually go. Book your transfer to the ship the day before and it works like a charm. The restaurant was great, with a good choice and reasonable prices. The conceirge recommended the 22nd street fish market for dinner one night, walking distance along the marina waterfront, and it too was a hit. Overall more than we expected, and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean, close to world cruise terminal”
Reviews.Author: dkcoll
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight before our Disney Cruise. This hotel is in a great location, friendly staff, warm chocolate chip cookies on arrival, free Internet access in lobby area, free transfers to cruise terminal, stored our luggage while on cruise & picked us up from cruise back to hotel. Fantastic service......only downside was the restaurant area is very small but really overall all the other positives outweigh that! Rooms spacious too! Would recommend :)

Reviews.Title: “I Normally Love Double Tree... But Not This Time”
Reviews.Author: Miatt
Reviews.Content: I usually love staying at Double Tree. They are clean, have good service and usually decently priced. Unfortunately, the Double Tree in San Pedro falls way below any Double Tree I have ever stayed at. We were staying here one night before a cruise the next day and lets just say I am happy it was only one night... I arrived at 3 PM, well 2:55 and went to check in. They told me my room was not ready yet, but she just needed to call housekeeping and it would only be a minute. I walked around the lobby for a second and was quickly called back to the front by the front desk agent. She told me it would be another 45 minutes to an hour before my room was ready, even though check-in time was at 3. She then told me I was welcome to use the restaurant... Strike 1: No apology, no attempting to make it better by offering a drink coupon or anything, just sent me in the direction of the restaurant. It would have been really easy for me to write a positive review if she had just apologized, that at least shows me that she cares. But I got nothing. Exhausted from a 9 hour drive, we decided we would eat lunch in the restaurant. Normally I don't like to eat in hotel restaurants because they are over priced and usually not very good, but we did not want to drive anywhere and decided we would give it a shot. Strike 2: The food and service at their restaurant is awful! For starters there was only 3 other people sitting there and there were 3 people serving. That would tell me each person would be responsible for one table and service should be quick. Oh was I wrong. We waited about 15 minutes just to be offered anything to drink and that was followed with a "What do you want??" We must have been inconveniencing her because she clearly didn't want to deal with us. 30 minutes later when we finally got the food it was so disgusting that we barely ate any of it because we thought we might throw up. We just wanted to get to our room, but we still had to wait. After our experience at the restaurant we went back to the front and I told the guy that we needed to get into our room. He looked at me like I was an idiot and asked what our room number was. I told him we didn't have one yet, which seemed to confuse him. Another 5 minutes went by of him fiddling around with the computer and finally we got our keys. Strike 3: I was never recognized as being a Honors Gold Member, I was never given any information about the hotel or about breakfast (which I am supposed to get for free as a benefit of being an Honors member) and I was still never given an apology. We got up to the room, and the room was clean and it seemed fine. My only complaint with the room is all of the dirty sheets (surely from the people the night before) sitting in the hall right in front of my door. How nice. When we got in the room it was very warm, so we turned the A/C down a couple notches and left to get a couple last minute things for our cruise the next morning. When we got back our room was freezing. So we turned the A/C (not the heat) up just a little. Next thing we knew it was super hot again, so back to turning it down. This went on all night and we ended up waking up for good at 5am because we could not tolerate it anymore. There was no happy medium. It was either hot or freezing cold. The hotel will allow you to arrange transportation to the port, but with how everything else had gone so far, we got a ride from family who was coming in that morning to cruise with us. We were able to leave our car parked at the hotel for the whole cruise, and honestly, that is the only reason I gave this hotel 2 stars instead of one. A couple other things to keep in mind. There are tons of kids at this hotel cruising with their families and it is like staying at a Chuck-E-Cheese. The entire night there were kids running up and down the halls, slamming doors and being extremely annoying. No, this is not the hotel's fault, but I still feel they should have done something about this. Also there is no wireless internet in the rooms. They have wired, but lets be honest, who uses wired anymore? In this day and age you use tablets or smart phones, and I'm pretty sure no one has an ethernet cord in their phone. In conclusion, this hotel is very close to the port, but there are other hotels close by as well. Even if you are an Honors member like me and want to stay at a Hilton because you want to use your points, or get points... Don't. I stayed there because I was able to use my points, so basically it was free, but I am not happy that I did. I wish I had saved my points and stayed elsewhere because this was not a good use of my points. Find somewhere else to stay if you are in the area for a cruise, I know we will.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: srholmgrn
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this property. We were booked on a 15 day cruise and found they would let us park our car in their lot without additional charges. From the time we checked in till we returned over two week later, everyone at the hotel treated us great. When we arrived the bell hop told us about the free parking., The front desk had our reservations in perfect order and two warm cookies waiting for us, Housekeeping had our room ready and in perfect order, even tho we checked in two hours early. I called the front desk and asked for a sea food restaurant in the area and they recommended 22nd Street Landing, a short walk from the hotel. Perfect. After a good night sleep we decided to enjoy the hotels breakfast buffet. Spendy!! The selection was good and the service was better. While we were having breakfast, Tommy, the hotel manager, stopped by and introduced himself (when was the last time that happened to you?). After breakfast the hotel shuttle delivered us to the ship and when we got back they picked us up and dropped us off at our car. There were two things I was not happy about. No free wifi in the room and the price of breakfast. We will be cruising again out of San Pedro and will be staying at the Doubletree.

Reviews.Title: “You're Paying For Location”
Reviews.Author: Meigzilla
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel, but I think it is overpriced for what you get. You are paying for location. It is very close to the Port of Los Angeles, so if you are going on a Disney or Carnival Cruise you are literally minutes away. The location next to marina is nice for walking and the views, but the amenities are lacking for the price of the rooms. For example, there is no fridge in the room (you can rent one for an extra cost), no free breakfast, no included internet access. There is internet access in the rooms...if you pay for it, and if you have a cable to access it. There is no wi-fi in the rooms at all. There is wi-fi in the main lobby area, but there are no quiet spots due to the fact that the restaurant and bar are open to and part of the lobby. When we were there some huge party was going on and it was very loud in the lobby area. I was trying to do some work because all I had was my tablet (so I could only access wi-fi) and I finally gave up and went upstairs around midnight, and the party was still going strong. Yeah, it was a Friday night, but it was disappointing that there were no quiet areas to work in. The pool was clean, but frigid. My kids, who love to swim, spent about 20 minutes in the water and then had to get out because they were freezing. The ice cold water is probably really nice in August, but not so great at the end of October. Our room was nice and clean, so were the linens. The bed was pretty comfortable. The bathroom had a sliding door on it, and no lock. This didn't bother us but might both some people. There is also no fan in the bathroom, so it gets very steamy and the mirror foggy, and you have to wait for it to clear. The door to the hotel room had a slow-closing mechanism on it to prevent the door from slamming shut, but it was a total pain because you either had to wait for it to close totally, or you had to manhandle it closed. If you don't wait, your door is wide open and anyone can just walk in, and if someone was trying to push their way through the door you would not be able to close it quickly. I don't think this is very safe, especially for women traveling alone. This hotel is also very spread out, so you will be doing a lot of walking to get to your room depending on where it is located. The final thing to be aware of it that since this hotel is so close to the port, if you like to sleep with the window open you will hear a constant (about every 90 seconds) horn blowing. I am not sure what it was, but it was constant. And it seemed to increase in frequency about 6:30 am. You can't really hear it when the windows are closed, though. Our room was also overlooking the marina, so maybe it wasn't as noticable on the other side of the hotel. If you want to be close to the Port, you can't beat the location. But you won't get as much for your money as you would at another hotel. You can find packages online that will add to what you get for your money (such as comp. breakfast, etc.), so I would recommend searching these out if you plan on booking here.

Reviews.Title: “No in-room wifi :(”
Reviews.Author: David L
Reviews.Content: We like this place. The rooms are comfortable and the staff is friendly. It's great to be at the marina even if you're not into sailing. They offer wifi in the lobbey but internet in the room is ethernet cable only! The cable is only 3 feet long so you are essentially tethered to the desk area. We had 2 rooms (which were across the hall even though we pre-requested adjoining rooms and the hotel wasn't that busy -- there are adjoining rooms but they had booked one of the pair to someone else -- I don't think they read the requests ahead of time on rooms booked on interenet). We were not able to access the internet in either room without help from the engineer due to trouble with their outdated tangle of cable wires. The cost was escessive-- $11.95/day, considering that more and more places are offering it free. And if you want access in both rooms, there is an etra $11.95 fee. So we took turns with our single short cable connection. My daughters couldn't use their tablet computor or wifi-ready ipod. Also, beware of the alarm clocks that are set for 4:00 in the morning. We couldn't figure out how to tun off alarm so the second night we unplugged the f-ing thing. Did you know that some hotel alarm clocks run on batteries when unplugged? We didn't. So on the third night we took it to the front desk for safekeeping (or else I mignt have tossed it against a wall !!).

Reviews.Title: “SAFE HARBOR CRUISE PARKING”
Reviews.Author: pharmgreg
Reviews.Content: If you are cruising out of San Pedro this hotel is the best place to start and finish you journey. They have a great hotel with friendly hosts and good food. Plus the free parking while you travel and shuttle service to and from the ship! You might want to use a GPS to get you there but its worth the trip to this great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Really Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: juninho_d
Reviews.Content: I have stayed something like 80 or 90 nights at this hotel over the last 3 years (or less) and I find it to be a perfect home away from home for me.. A nice sized room with all of the usual Doubletree/Hilton facilities including a nice comfortable bed, overlooking a calm and quiet marina.. A nice breakfast buffet (you can order a'la carte, of course).. Ample free parking.. and really, really friendly and capable staff who really do make a difference.. Always there for you if you need them.. OK, so, I'm a bit of a regular, and many of the staff know me pretty well by now, so you might think this has influenced my judgement and ratings.. but, I can honestly say that is not the case.. Far from it, indeed.. I found that all of the things that I like about this hotel were right there the very first time that I visited.. They have recently upgraded to flat screen TV's and cable. The internet can be a bit slow, but they are working on that, I believe. The bathrooms, whilst cleaned and serviced with diligence and care might be due a refurb soon.. I've never spent much time in the bar, or the restaurant at night, but both seem convivial enough and the odd time I have used them, they served their purposes ;-) Downsides..? Ok, yes, there is one.. Can't say it affects me personally, but here you go.. On cruise turnaround days the hotel is very busy.. The only significant impacts I have noticed of this are that a) the pool area can get a little crowded (as opposed to my being there on my own, some days) and b) there can be a wait for your room on check in on these days as, often, they are turning around a large proportion of the rooms in the hotel (as a set of guests depart the hotel to check on to their cruises, a new set arrives from the recently docked ship)... They work very hard, from what I can see, to minimise impacts from this, but they are clear about their check in times.. If you arrive early, they will try and help, but you may also be waiting.. I have seen many folks trying to check in pretty early and, well, when they are turning 'round som many rooms, that will lead to the inevitable, I'm afraid.. Apart from that, I cannot think of anything else from my experiences..

Reviews.Title: “Great View of the Marina.”
Reviews.Author: dr__dawggy
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here pre-cruise. Location was ideally suited for this purpose. The cruise terminal was no more than 10 minutes away and the hotel provides a free shuttle. Check in was fast, efficient and the front desk staff were friendly as well as competent. As others have noted, carpet in the hallway is stained and not very clean, which caused us some trepidation as we navigated the hallways on the way to our room. However, the room itself was very pleasant,with a king bed, desk,well appointed bath and carpet that was at least one generation newer than in the hall. We were a bit disappointed that no in room wi-fi was available...rendering our ipad useless without returning to the lobby. We ate breakfast in the dining room....and found it a bit pricey (not outlandishly so....but on the high side, even for Los Angeles). Service was a bit slow.....but one the bright side, the oatmeal was done to perfection....unlike many restaurants where oatmeal is cooked too long and is served up as a gloppy, gooey mess.Muffins were fresh as well and the coffee was hot....We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here before our cruise”
Reviews.Author: LarryE108
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we could leave our car in the lot while we took a 14 day cruise to Hawaii. We stayed in Oct. 2011. We used the complimentary shuttle to and from the ship. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ymm - warm chocolate chip cookies as a greeting”
Reviews.Author: laurae
Reviews.Content: We booked the Double tree park and cruise package, which included parking, room and transportation to the port for our cruise. Nice, quiet location and a few eating places close by just just might have to walk about 1/2 to 1 mile. We arrived early (about noon) and our room was not ready, so we walked around for a while and then had lunch on the hotel patio and by 2pm or 3pm our room was ready. We were given bottles of water to accommodate our waiting. We had a view of the port and the room was nicely appointed. 2 queen beds, desk and chair, but no lounging chair. The hallway seemed very run down, with the carpet needing replaced and some wall repair work needed, but the rooms were clean and seemed updated. The bell staff, which also provide the transportation to and from the port are great. You sign up for your port transportation the day before your cruise and on the way back, just call the number they give you and they pick you up. We had just missed the shuttle when I called and so the person working the bell desk, decided to pick us up, so we didn't have to wait as long, even though they only quoted 20 minutes to wait, we only waited 5 minutes to be picked up after the cruise. Felt the hotel Restaurant was not that great.. food was just so so and the service wasn't fast. There is a "business center" which is 2 computers and printer in the bar / restaurant area. It is free to use. Their is slow wireless in the lobby area, but only wired service in the rooms. That is a disappointing for tablet users.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed by the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: airline65
Reviews.Content: Spent two days before our cruise and found this hotel to be a delight to stay in from the moment we arrived with their welcoming hot chocolate cookies to the time we got the complimentary shuttle to the ship the friendly staff could not do enough to make our stay a good one I highly recommend this hotel to cruise travellers if they are going out of San Pedro and the rooms overlooking the marine with balcony are just great. Thanks for a great stay Doubletree. Airline65

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travelholicaussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before a cruise out of Port of Los Angeles. The hotel does offer free shuttle bus service to the cruise terminal which is about the only thing this place had going for it. We have 2 kids aged 5 & 6 years, we were placed on the 3rd floor (the top) of this old run down place and were horrified to see that the windows could be fully opened to a direct 3 story drop. Needless to say kids were kept well away. There was a wedding in the conference room the night we stayed, after several hours of trying to sleep through it I called reception to ask what time the wedding would finish, they replied they didn't know. Being as how it was in their hotel you'd think they would have some idea. After the wedding finished about 1:30am several "merry" guests made their way around the hotel screaming before finishing up by vomiting in the hallway and then smashing their glass bottle full of some red alcohol all over the wall. This was still there at 9am the next morning when we headed to breakfast. The floors looked like they hadn't been vacummed in months although the room itself was clean enough. Overall would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: CathyWolf
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before a cruise. The hotel was very comfortable, front desk was efficient, and they had great marina views. We were given the extra cost upgrade per our request while making the reservation and had a nice balcony room right over the marina. We were with a friend and he paid for the same upgrade, but they made a mistake on his initial room, no view/balcony, so he had to wait a while for the appropriate room (we did check in earlier than their posted check-in time tho). We stayed using their cruise/parking package and we left our car in their lot for 9 days and were conveniently shuttled to and from the port.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome & Warm Cookies too!”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: Arriving from a sleepless overnight overseas flight at 9am we were hours too early for check-in but were still welcomed & told a room would be cleaned for us. Our luggage was stored so we decided to have breakfast in the restaurant while we waited. Room was ready at 11am, large, well decorated, spotlessly clean and a lovely marina view. Hotel was quiet, we even managed a nap, the bed was super comfortable! Later we went for a walk, not a lot around the area but glad to be in a quiet place. Later we returned to the restaurant for dinner and found a good menu at good prices, we didn't want 5 star dining and were grateful for the choices on the menu. A great nights sleep, breakfast next morning was very busy but again good food at good prices. There were 2 cruise ships leaving that day and we were on the Sapphire Princess & were dropped off by the hotel shuttle. A terrific start to our holiday, as I said in the title, warm welcome and warm cookies to take to our room as well! Well, done.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome view and warm cookies”
Reviews.Author: NotDiscombobulated
Reviews.Content: This place is real nice and comfy.they also give u warm freshbaked cookies . Lots of space and its hidden in the back of pedro

Reviews.Title: “Not great...but not bad.”
Reviews.Author: kdesai78
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of their older hotelsâ€¦.well at least the rooms made it seem like it. Beds were comfortable of course but the bathroom seemed a little rundown. The tub looked like it needed a damn good scrubbing. I stayed in room 322. I also noticed the room door didnâ€™t close properly. I had gone downstairs to get some toothpaste and when I came back up the door looked a little open. I turned the handle without using the key and it opened right upâ€¦I shut it again and it opened right up again. Pretty much the door didnâ€™t close properly unless I pulled it all the way shutâ€¦I notified them when I left so hopefully they fixed it. I walked around the place before I left and it was a pretty cool place since it was right there on the dockâ€¦.sailboats everywhere when you walk out the back. No minifridge or microwave. Wifi was not free. The fitness room had 2-3 Cardio machines and had some dumbbells. Carpets and walls of the room and halls of the hotel needed a good cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Thing wrong with this spot”
Reviews.Author: bill s
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business, will be back for pleasure.. Had a great Double bed room, nice view, comfy bed and enjoyed my 2 nights. Marina gives plenty to do and see - and the food was great as well. Enjoyed my time at this hotel for sure... Will be returning with my Family in November..

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: k t
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Double Tree. Nice location on the marina but the service all together was terrible. We booked two joining rooms months ahead, but when we checked in our rooms, we were in separate parts of the hotel. We were told by their rude staff that nothing could be done and the only rooms they had that were adjoining were booked. After complaining we were given rooms next to each other but not adjoining in the smoking area of the hotel. After complaining again the supposed adjoining rooms that were booked suddenly became available. The rooms were fairly clean but things like the bathroom door was broken in both rooms, the front door didn't lock properly, we had to have both modems replaced to access internet. Not much more can be said about the restaurant that had overpriced food and service was again rude. Would not recommend staying at this hotel unless management was replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kat_919
Reviews.Content: have family in san Pedro but "no room in the INN"..so I booked 2 nights with my Hilton Honors points. Great location. a real plus! The marina is outside the back door. has a great walk about with LOTS of ships..service was excellent. I upgraded for $15.00/a night and got a picture view of the Marina. It was well worth it. Beds comfy and clean. Decor nice but seemed semi distressed, meaning they need to replace soon. Nice breakfast area but the breakfast buffet food was so-so. I have had better. Service excellent! Went to the bar to have a speciality drink before dinner and it was OK..nothing to rave about. Has a fithness Center which was good. I would book again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: SFpol
Reviews.Content: I didn't get a chance to enjoy much of this hotel, but my room was quiet and comfortable and had a nice view overlooking the harbor. Bed was comfy and bathroom a little outdated. I never got my HHonors free water despite asking twice, but I can live without that. Doubt I will ever need to be in this part of LA again, but would definitely stay here again if I were.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a wedding and relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: travelerinva801
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Doubletree. Every staff person I encountered was friendly, pleasant, and helpful. The location was great and we loved the view from our marina room. I woke up to the sound of seals barking in the distance!The huevos rancheros at breakfast were very tasty - glad I skipped the buffet. Do agree with a previous poster that having the kitchen open into the main lobby was a bit distracting. We were here for a wedding and the service, food, and location were all great. We liked being able to walk over to Cabrillo Beach. The neighborhood of San Pedro was very cute and had a lot of nice restaurants as well. Oh, and I liked the digital, easy to control aircon units in the rooms. Only cons: bed was a little too soft to be comfy (and I like a soft bed) along with pillows that were a bit too squashy. Carpet in the hallway was run down and stained. Pool claimed to be heated but was pretty dang cold! And a little stingy with the wifi, only available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotels in the region”
Reviews.Author: Paul E
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for business, and what a pleasant surprise. We usually stay at another brand, but this property, Marina, Water, weather, made our stay as close to perfect as you can get. The service and staff we encountered was awesome. Especially Peter and Tommy Spencer - the General Manager, who we talked to in the Lobby on our way in. Made us feel at home and most welcome. We will certainly find a reason to head back to the area and stay at this hotel again. Cannot go wrong.....

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly. Felt very comfortable there. Great setting!”
Reviews.Author: grandory
Reviews.Content: The hotel was at the marina so very aesthetic setting and nice area to walk around. No shops, but pleasant. Hotel had a warm feeling. Bar and downstairs area was well-lit and family-friendly feeling. As single woman, I was comfortable getting a glass of wine and checking email. All staff seemed very friendly. Room was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but skanky maintenance”
Reviews.Author: ladama
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location overlooking the L.A. Harbor and is a short walk from a park. When we first walked in I couldnt believe it was a Doubletree. Maintenance and repair of the common areas is lacking. The carpets were filthy in all the common areas and everything looked worn. The kitchen door opens into the main reception/lounge area. The door was constantly propped open allowing everyone in the lobby to look into the kitchen and cooking smells to waft up the stairwells into the sleeping room areas of the hotel. We were on the waterfront, but everything smelled of fried food. Our room did have a lovely view of the Harbor and once we were in it we were at ease. Management needs to wake up! They are missing an opportunity here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience...”
Reviews.Author: jiggerb
Reviews.Content: Having stayed several times at the Crowne Plaza (CP) as a pre-cruise hotel, we thought weâ€™d give the Doubletree (DT) a try. We were quite pleased. The price of the Park/Sail package between the two properties is relatively the same. We do prefer the underground parking of the CP though the DT has a better breakfast buffet (the CP does not serve pork products). We liked having our two DT free cocktails outside with the water view and we felt very welcome overall at the property. The room we had wasnâ€™t as large as what weâ€™ve had at the CP though it was still quite nice. We didnâ€™t pay for the upgraded marina view at the DT and missed having a water view as we have at the CP from most rooms. It may sound as if we prefer the CP. Reality is they are both very nice places to stay and weâ€™d return to either. Shuttle services at both are also very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “It is "Worth" the short commute,”
Reviews.Author: BartonRix
Reviews.Content: I have gone out of my way to do the short commute in the LA Basin to stay @ this property. Everything I need is on property, plus the view of the harbor is the "value added". Safe, Convenient, Friendly Staff, Good Value for the money.. I stay here 4/6 times a year, by choice.

Reviews.Title: “It's Time......”
Reviews.Author: davidandrose1
Reviews.Content: Its time....to update this property. While my bed was comfy and everything worked well, there's a lot that needs to be updated or replaced, as noted by numerous other reviewers. Carpeting throughout the hotel was incredibly dirty...uncleanable IMO. Pepto-bismo colored tile in bathroom was desperate to be reunited with great-grandma's avacado-colored appliances, which were retired to a dumpster decades ago. While the front-desk staff was polite and my curt waiter for dinner one night allowed me to bring in a half bottle of. My own wine, I can't imagine that the hotels managers live in homes where the common areas have filth that's as ground-in as it is here. The hotels owners need to reinvest , or the gravy-train they're reaping today from furnishings that were long-ago paid for, will turn on them. Step up, or step aside. The time has come.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne31
Reviews.Content: Great Location Friendly Staff! We meet friends there for the 4th of July. Had a great time. The food and outdoor dining was good and the view of the Harbor was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good location, never a bad stay at Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: Lexzander
Reviews.Content: Like the title says, Never a bad stay at Hilton. Read the reviews so I was ready for a letdown, However that said never a bad stay at any Hilton I have been to. NOTE this is not a new cheap location. Having lived at the ocean most my life I understand that marina/beach locations are typically not as fresh and fancy. However in true Hilton fashion they have worked very hard to keep this property nice and I would say to my expectations. Yes the rollers wear on the stupid pocket doors.........just keep in mind its an ocean location. When I called for a confirmation on the parking of my rig, (Parking is huge and free), I got a woman named Catherine with a wonderful exotic accent, which promptly told me sorry hotel was booked. I explained I had reservations and she apologized just saying they were booked and I did not have a room. I immediately started checking my e mails to see if i screwed up and began looking for alternative accommodations. A couple more calls I got a different attendant and everything was good. So if you call and anybody named Catherine answer's its probably best to hang up and try for another attendant, so she could possibly mess up your reservations. I don't know if she was messing with me or just out to lunch. All in all a nice place in the marina, probably the safest part of San Pedro.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT pre-cruise stay at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: maja651
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Doubletree (April 28-April 30) prior to our cruise on the NCL Star. We arrived late on the first night but were pleasantly surprised when we were upgraded to a room with a balcony overlooking the marina. We had booked the cheapest king bed room. The staff at this hotel is what makes this place what is is, They are the best! This staff is as good as if not better than some of the 5* properties we have stayed at in the past (Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, etc.). I would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to stay there again some day in the future!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels in San Pedro”
Reviews.Author: LBeach99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our Hawaii cruise and had a wonderful stay. The room was ready when we checked in, the hotel restaurant was great (delicious hot wings and pizza) and the warm chocolate chip cookies were a great snack after a long day of driving. We've stayed here before and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to like this place.”
Reviews.Author: davegidd
Reviews.Content: I worked at a DoubleTree hotel years ago and have fond memories of the company, so I had hoped that now being part of Hilton would have improved the brand. Unfortunately, that isn't the case, at least at this property. We were staying one night before a cruise and for that purpose the location is nice with beautiful views of a marina. There really isn't anything within walking distance, but the hotel shuttle will take you anywhere within 5 miles, so that gives you some options even if you don't have a car. The staff overall was very nice, but there seems to be a lack of training. Everyone does seem to try hard to be pleasant, which is a definite plus these days. I did have to wait while the valet guys rolled each other around on the luggage carts though. They could have easily hit someone coming out of the front door of the hotel....I'm sure management would be horrified if they saw this going on. Once I got their attention they were good about signing us up for the port shuttle the next morning. We arrived at 2pm and our room wasn't ready (check-in is 4pm), which we understand. We were told that the front desk would call us when the room was ready, which never happened. If you aren't going to follow through, don't offer to do it. They did offer to store our luggage and that worked out fine. We wandered around the marina and had lunch in the hotel's restaurant to kill time, so it wasn't a big deal. The food in the restaurant is very good, they offer a wide selection (although they were out of things at dinner), and the prices are reasonable for a hotel. The service was good at lunch, but very poor at dinner...we were never offered drinks other than water and the check was dropped off without asking if we wanted dessert. We received our Gold Hilton Honors benefits with room upgraded to marina view even though we were staying on points, which was nice. I expect to get them, but not necessarily without asking. Everything was in order and properly presented at check-in. Now for the huge flaw where this property really falls on its face. The place is filthy. Honestly, I've stayed in $50 motels that were cleaner than this hotel. I was shocked and I'm not very picky. All of the furniture in the lobby was either dirty, extremely worn, or both. There was trash on the floor, the carpets were dirty and needed vacuuming, and there were paper towels strewn all over the public restroom. There is a pool table in the lobby that has a light fixture over it that had two burned out bulbs and a missing shade. Really tacky. Take it out if you can't fix it. The room itself (room 357), while fairly spacious, was not properly cleaned by any stretch of the imagination. The bathroom floor was disgusting and had not been mopped because it had small chunks of dirt still on it. The bottom of the bathtub needed to be scrubbed, the shower curtain rod was about to fall down, the electrical outlet and light switch were very dirty, and the back of the door had a huge black smudge that looked like mold from inside the wall pocket it slides into. In the room, one of the beds was so rumpled it looked like all they did was remake a slept-in bed (I convinced myself it was just wrinkled), there were cobwebs floating around on the ceiling above the desk, the floor lamp had huge yellow stains on the shade, the lamp by the bed had something spewed up the inside, and the internet cable on the desk was broken so it wouldn't clip into the computer (I bring my own anyway, but I shouldn't have to). The carpet looked clean enough except for some crumbs indicating it hadn't been vacuumed. The upholstered chair had crumbs all over it and the desk chair was filthy. Note that the marina view rooms have the possibility of noise from people walking/talking along the walkway and it can be noisy if there is a party going on at the adjacent yacht club. This hotel has a lot of potenial, but I'm sorry to say it isn't living up to it. I'm sure it gets a lot of rough traffic with all the kids embarking Disney cruises, but that's no excuse for poor housekeeping. I would say that overall the noise level here is acceptable even with the kids running around. The old A/C unit was very quiet and worked properly. There is no way I'd pay the regular rates for this hotel. I might stay here again using points or with an extremely discounted rate under the same circumstances. All in all it was tolerable and the staff was nice, but wouldn't cut it if you are paying full price. Like I said at the beginning, I really did want to like this place and I did have my expectations in check, but I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot - close to cruise ship!”
Reviews.Author: PinkSurvivor
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before our NCL Mexican cruise. Since I am Honors Gold, we were upgraded to a Marina view room with full breakfast. Room was average. Room could use some updating - - outdated bathroom. But, OK. Location to the cruise ships - great! View of marina - interesting! Enoyed the morning walk around the area. Breakfast was good. When we checked in, we were asked if we were going on a cruise. We were then told about the FREE parking while we were on the cruise. We left our car for a week & saved $12 a day!! Thanks fo the helpful front desk!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect before our cruise”
Reviews.Author: baedteeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed the night before our cruise in a marina view room. We loved the view. The bed and pillows were some of the most comfortable encountered in a hotel. The location is very quiet. We had the hotel van drive us to dinner and breakfast and chose to walk back to the hotel and enjoy the marina and beach scenery and get some exercise. The van also drove us to the cruise terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff, but needs a good cleaning!”
Reviews.Author: NyPickytraveler
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here overnight. The staff was great and very helpful. The common areas and the room itself I found to be in need of a good cleaning! All the carpets(both in the rooms and hallways) were well used and stained, including the chairs in the room. Dust was everywhere, seemed as if nothing had been dusted for a very long time! There was a lot of hair in one of the beds, which totally grossed us out...it seemed that someone had slept in the bed and the sheets were never changed...we ended up all sleeping together in one bed. There is nothing to do around the hotel, although the setting was quite nice. They will shuttle you to the Port of Call complex which has restaurants, but to tell you the truth I felt a little unsafe at times. Overall being a loyal Hilton guest...I was unpleasantly surprised and disappointed with this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - Pre Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Murraya
Reviews.Content: We booked the Fly N Stay package that included a marina view room, transfers to & from LAX, 2 drinks in lounge, hot buffet breakfast and transfer to the ship. We were greeted by a friendly and efficient staff. Our room was huge with a patio overlooking the marina. We had a nice dinner in the restaurant. Free wireless internet in the lobby area. After breakfast we had a nice long walk around the beautiful marina. A great place to stay when sailing out of the Port of Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “From Boats to Ships!”
Reviews.Author: GOmaha
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to spend 24 hours at this nice hotel prior to starting a cruise ship vacation. There are a few other hotels closer to the Port of Los Angeles but none will have such a great view of yachts and sailboats of all shapes and sizes. The hotel does a brisk cruise ship business and offers free shuttles as well as park and cruise. The proximity to various yacht clubs, restaurants, marinas and the busy Port of Los Angeles makes this an interesting and convenient place to stay. The staff at the hotel were efficient and even the on-site restaurant provides better than average meals served on a nice patio with a view of the marina. The building is not fancy but in good condition and the marina view rooms make you feel a part of the action!

Reviews.Title: “great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarolMemphis
Reviews.Content: rented a limo through the hotel to get here from LAX - 4 people, 5 large bags - $95 we are hilton honors so both rooms were upgraded to balcony and free great breakfast buffet lovely view of marina dinner in restaurant here reasonable and fine nice lobby and internet stations free shuttle to cruise with reservations taken for that very happy with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for pre-cruise stay and park!!”
Reviews.Author: sbart20
Reviews.Content: Just had to report what an excellent hotel this was for our one night pre-cruise and parking included. Staff, rooms, restaurant, service and pier transfers were great and couldn't have been better--would not hesitate to stay again and also would recommend to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: SouthFLTraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel on a three day business trip. The location was great, directly on the marina. Try to book a marina view room, the night view over the boats were outstanding. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. It was a drive (2-3 miles) to any major restaurants or stores. The food in the hotel lobby restaurant was good, as was the service. Also, there was free WiFi in the lobby, with comfortable seating. I can see where there would be a great pre and post cruise hotel, as it is close to the LA cruise terminal. Overall I enjoyed my stay at this hotel, and would stay there again if I was in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Shoking room maintance with water damage and leaks.”
Reviews.Author: rudy737
Reviews.Content: Initially a pretty average hotel. First room at the end of the building suffered from inconsistent hot water in the shower going cold then hot repeatedly. A guest I met had a similar experience. After a complaint I was "upgraded" to a room which was on paper supposed to be nicer. Once I was in the room, I noticed it had a connecting locked door which was beside another room full of Air Tahiti crew partying into the early hours of the morning. Rather than telling them to respect other guest they made me move to another room which had water damage with a giant dripping wet patch on the roof which leaked onto my laptop. I was given a considerable discount for my one week stay but this still didnâ€™t compensate. I would avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Truthdays
Reviews.Content: -fast foiod quality in the dining room...just gross food, but good service -event rooms are below the Hotel rooms and they blast music so loud you can't hear anything (parties last until midnight) -hot water issues -ac unit non-functional

Reviews.Title: “Warm Cookies!”
Reviews.Author: DirectorJay
Reviews.Content: Usually I don't do reviews online but this one hit me. I was welcomed by a really nice staff and given a cookie. I noticed that it was warm and I took a bite and it was so delicious. I went up to my room and it was clean and well maintained. So I accidentally bought a movie which costs like $17 and I panicked. I was thinking so hard how to tell the front desk that I really literally accidentally bought a movie. The next morning I saw fresh faces of staff and I explained that story and they were more than willing to help me and I got my money back. I also asked questions and I didn't just get a yes/no, they answered it in a very helpful manner. Just give me an extra 30secs of your time and you get a great review such as this one! Thanks Doubletree

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: njwhoser
Reviews.Content: A hotel that delivers on service and hospitality. The room i was assigned was better than expected. I paid the extra $30 for a "marina view" and was well worth the extra money.I had two full windows that had a wonderful view of marina water and boats. The hotel sits on cabillo marina and my view from the room was just gorgeous. While the room was as expected for a doubletree hotel the staff more than made my stay wonderful. Every person I encountered was welcoming and courtesy. When you walk through the hotel every person you pass says "hello" or "may i help you". I especially recommend getting a tahitian beer and sitting on the patio overlooking the patio.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jollyjenks
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night whist touring around LA, cant fault the Hotel, great service, clean, friendly staff, Pool & Hot tub Good, food was good in Hotel, had dinner & breakfast, Free Pool in Bar Area , kept the childrenn quiet whilst we enjoyed a beer , Marina Offers good views, love the boats ! Free Parking, my only moan is they charge for internet in the rooms, nowadays , most hotels offer for free, well done doubletree for making our stay welcome and enjoyable thank you

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, dumpy area”
Reviews.Author: travelersfromCO
Reviews.Content: San Pedro has gone down hill.....decent hotel, if the Marina weren't there, nothing to look at. Bar Service was lacking. Rooms have been nicely redone although the bathrooms could use some attention.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Pedro, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: sfman38
Reviews.Content: I had a wholly different experience than the last two entries. I was visiting San Pedro for the first time and arrived at the hotel around 3:00 p.m. I was able to check in early and they had the warm cookies ready! The desk staff was very courteous and was always present as I passed by. They were able to recommend some local restaurants and provided a map of the area, which was helpful. My room was on the first floor and had a nice patio area with seating and a coffee table. If you stay here I suggest you request a first floor patio room because the other floors do not have balconys. The room itself was nice and clean, although quite small. However, the space was well used and I did not feel cramped- there was a desk and lounge chair. The bathroom was good and the water pressure steady. There was a 32 inch plasma TV which was a great feature. The A/C worked great, and there was even a wireless remote so I could adjust it from my bed if it was too hot or cold during the night (but I didn't need to). The hotel location is good, about a 10 minute walk from a nice beach area, with the marina right outside. The hotel has a good gift shop, restaurant, and lounge area with a pool table. I had a quick meal in the lounge and the clam chowder and bananas foster were great. Free WiFi in the lounge also is a nice touch ($12 in rooms). There are also free tennis courts on property so bring your raquets if you play. Oh yeah, and the fitness center has a sauna! One very mior complaint- the room service attendants could probably check the hallways more frequently as there were many room service trays sitting outside the rooms. Not a big deal but it didn't look very tidy. Overall this was a great experience. The hotel exceeded my expectations and if I visit San Pedro again, I will most definitely stay here as there are only a few hotels in the area and this one appeared to be the best by far.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: aanita66
Reviews.Content: BE VERY CAREFUL, when booking online. THEY WILL NOT WORK WITH YOU IF THERE ARE ANY CHANGES IN YOUR PLANS. I made a reservation, and paid for 2 nites - 3 months in advance for an aunt that was coming into town for a grad in June. She passed away in April and I contacted the hotel to tell them what happened and to see if I could possibly use the rooms at another time...I was told NO, that there was nothing they could do, I was not asking for a refund, just the ability to use the rooms at another time....They didn't care, they already had my money, and were fine that no one used the rooms. THIS IS TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. I WILL NEVER AGAIN STAY IN A DOUBLETREE OR HILTON, AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Upcoming Pre-Cruise Stay - Great Customer Service Experience”
Reviews.Author: DETAILEDGUY
Reviews.Content: Checked Out the DoubleTree & Crowne Plaza For A Pre-Cruise Stay In June. Found The DoubleTree Staff To Be Very Courteous & Professional. Received Immediate & Very Satisfactory Answers To All My Questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay when going on a cruise out of San Pedro”
Reviews.Author: dsjohuang
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night prior to going on a cruise that was leaving from San Pedro. The hotel allowed us to park our car in their lot for the week we were gone and provided shuttle service to and from hotel to the pier. The room is comfortable and clean. Quiet. The food at the restaurant is good. So after a long drive to the hotel on the night before we were departing for the cruise, it's great to be able to relax in the hotel and not have to go out again. The shuttle service was fast and efficient. Overall this is a great place to stay at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view from the room!!”
Reviews.Author: meeravelury
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely place!! Cozy rooms surely recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: nanasnest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree, San Pedro for one night pre-cruise. We had a room with a marina view and complimentary breakfast. We enjoyed watching the activity on the marina the next day and also took a walk. It was the opening day of the yacht club. The staff here are extremely nice and helpful. It makes a big difference. We booked the shuttle for the cruise the next day for 1:30pm and were allowed to check out late with no problem. We ate dinner in the restaurant and found it pleasant and the price for our meal was reasonable. I will definitely stay here again on my next cruise as it was a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: chitravelers11
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night here but service was great, room was clean and comfortable and the breakfast was fine. Our room was next to the ice machine so when we asked to be moved, we were given a nice room on the marina side. Doubletree has some of the most comfortable beds and this was no exception. Breakfast was hot and plentiful. Overall, a solid value. The marina has a nice walkway and there is a new park close by but otherwise it's a bit isolated. You'll need to drive out a ways for restaurants. Be sure to drive around the peninsula and visit Huntington Beach.

Reviews.Title: “I would do this again, for sure.”
Reviews.Author: ArgyleJoshTaylor
Reviews.Content: After delayed flights and missed meals, I was in a crappy mood when we finally got to the hotel and I was itching for a reason to hate it. I could not find any. This was a one night stay before a cruise. We booked the Fly and Cruise package which is a great value. The package included vouchers for drinks and breakfast. I have stayed places where employees look at vouchers and treat you like a poor relation. That was not the case here. The room was very nice and had a great view, even from the first floor which is above ground level. The room service menu was not limited and the prices were very reasonable. The service was very prompt. The next day we actually saw the place in daylight and we liked it. The promenade around the marina was an excellent way to walk off a very nice and varied buffet breakfast. But don't let 'buffet' fool you, this is a real restaurant, not a continental counter in the lobby. Everyone was polite, professional and friendly. The facilities were very clean and nicely decorated. The location was great for a cruise. Overall, this was a great way to start a vacation. I have stayed in other places that specialize in the pre-cruise trade and felt like I was in a people factory. I really could not find a downside to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay In San Pedro”
Reviews.Author: Jaid96
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at many Doubletree hotels and I was really impressed with this one. The rooms were big, clean and inviting, while the beds were quite possibly the most comfortable ones Ive slept on recently. I was traveling on business, and this hotel was perfectly accomodating. The hotel bar was open everynight at least till midnight, and the food was a little pricey but very tasty. This is a great place to stay if your looking to go on a cruise because the port is right there. I was very happy with my stay here, because it was nice and very close to work...however if I was going to visit LA proper, Id stay allot closer in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, best location in San Pedro”
Reviews.Author: cosmo185
Reviews.Content: We felt welcomed and comfortable in this hotel. When we checked in, the front desk lady gave us two delicious oatmeal cookies baked at the property, I believe. We looked at the ingredients and instead of usual "chemistry coctail", they had only wholesome ingedients. They were yummy! The hotel is located in the best part of San Pedro, right next to marina and there is a nice promenade along the marina. The rest of San Pedro is not impressive at all, and this part where we stayed was the nicest and safest. We also have only the best to say for the hotel staff, especially the manager at the reception (nice tall gentleman with European accent). When we got tired from our walk to SP downtown, and a bit scared at night (two girls alone in an unknown area), they sent us a shuttle to pick us up. The driver was also a super nice guy and we had a nice chat on our way back. We were also very happy that this hotel provides two complimentary Internet-connected computers and even a printer, so we were able to print out Mapquest page to our next destination in LA . I would definitely reccomend this hotel if you need to stay in San Pedro.

Reviews.Title: “Super cruise and park deal”
Reviews.Author: CoastOnIn
Reviews.Content: Booked on priceline for a precruise stay and park.Received a 2 queen room with spacious balcony and BEAUTIFUL view of the marina. No wait at check in and the warm cookies were delicious. Key cards were temperamental and hotel rectified situation. Had dinner and breakfast in the hotel restaurant and was satisfied with each meal for taste, quality, and price. The room was clean and supplied nuetrogena bath products. Lovely area and a safe place to park your car while cruising. Shuttle service to the port was quick and easy, be sure to book a spot the night before. Pick up was not as quick due to 3 ships all emptying and filling at virtually the same time and the port area was chaotic, the shuttle driver did not see us on the "island" and drove by, my phone was shut off and I missed her call trying to locate us in the crowd. Lesson learned, be on the island when calling hotel for pick up, and have the phone number you gave them the prior week activated. Doubletree has courteous employees and I would most definitely stay here for my next cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Basset Hound Lover
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the convenience of being close to the cruise ship port, and couldn't be happier with the hotel, the staff, the location, and even a shuttle bus to the terminal ! We had a king room with a balcony overlooking the marina. The rooms were very nice and comfy bedding. The on site restaurant was great, and the staff very friendly and helpful. I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree was ok before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: Norm174
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Doubletree Hotel in San Pedro before a cruise to the Mexican Riviera on the Mariner of the Seas. We had a rate of $174.00 which was negotiated with the hotel due to the difference between the online price and what the reservation desk first offered with our AAA discount. We took the Super Shuttle from the airport to the hotel and arrived before the 4:00 p.m. check in. The hotel locked our luggage in a storage area so we were free to sit outside on their patio to have food and drinks. The waiter was very friendly and provided great service. After 4:00 p.m. we asked the front desk if we could check in but were told we should come back in about 10-15 minutes. This happened 2 more times. Each time the front desk had to call housekeeping to see if the room was ready. Finally at 4:45 p.m. we were able to check in. I had reminded the front desk we had a free breakfast and they brought our coupons up to the room later. We signed up for the hotelâ€™s shuttle the following morning to take us to the cruise port which really worked out well. When the Super Shuttle dropped us off at the hotel, the bellman asked if we wanted to take the hotelâ€™s shuttle around the marina area for dinner at any of the restaurants. We declined, wishing now that we had. Dinner in the hotelâ€™s restaurant was more than I thought we should have spent. When we were leaving port the next day we saw all the restaurants we could have eaten at if we had chosen the hotelâ€™s shuttle around the marina. The balcony we had with our room wasnâ€™t the greatest. When we sat in the chairs, we couldnâ€™t see the marina. All of the balconyâ€™s were connected, so there is no privacy. The only thing stopping other guest from wandering onto another balcony was a small gate with a lock on it, but easy enough to step over. The hotel location was nice. We walked around the marina after dinner looking at all the boats. The Doubletree provided us exactly what we needed: a place to stay before our cruise, transportation to the cruise port and breakfast. Would we stay there again â€“ maybe not. We might try the Crowne Plaza if we were ever cruising out of San Pedro again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in San Pedro”
Reviews.Author: YKexplorers
Reviews.Content: We came to San Pedro with our kids and another couple. Our kids really enjoyed the pool and hot tub - and the one eyed cat which hung out at the pool our last day. We liked the clean and comfortable rooms, the wonderful beds with feather pillows - and that there was enough room for all of us to play cards in the evenings, and when it was too windy to play at the pool. We didn't interact with the staff much, but we didn't need to, we had everything we needed. Our two quibbles were: There was no on site laundry, and we couldn't bring ourselves to pay $3 to get a pair of socks laundered through the of-site laundry; and We didn't eat at the restaurant, we found it too pricy for our budget.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoGoat
Reviews.Content: We were unable to check in until approx. 4:00 PM although others were allowed to. My original room was given to another person checking in. When I got to the room and took a shower, there was no hot water. If you let it run for ten minutes you would get luke warm water. Two days no newspaper was left at the door. One day our room was not cleaned althought the do not desturb sign was removed by 9:30 AM. I would not recommend this hotel. PS: they also screwed up my Hilton Rewards number.

Reviews.Title: “We can't believe we paid to stay here”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveVegas777
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were not ready until 4 PM. We paid extra for a room with a balcony. We had to share a balcony with the room next to us. They were smokers so we didn't use it much. If you stay here, do NOT allow them to put you in a room anywhere near the lobby. They allow large groups to congregate/party there at all hours. Calls to the lobby will get you know where. I made a video w/sound to send to Doubletree to let them know what it sounded like from our room from 6:30 AM until 9AM, it was a LOUD party. No maid service. We had to call and request it. Several charges were made to our room that were not ours. We had to stand for an hour as they went through every room charge ticket to verify that the charges weren't ours. The cafe food and service were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise stay great!”
Reviews.Author: georgeny_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed one evening, picked for proximity to cruise ship port for Princess Sapphire sailing May 2nd. Staff were excellent and we enjoyed dining outside overlooking marina. Food excellent, prices reasonable enough. Room clean and bed provided best sleep ever in a hotel, very comfortable! Hotel staff all extremely cordial can't say enough good about them. Hotel provided FREE shuttle to cruise ship in morning via their own vans. ONLY downside is internet in room not FREE! Must pay forget how much but something in are of $12 or some such. They do provide FREE wireless in lobby. Don't understand why they do this considering that in today's world even flop houses pretty much offer free internet now. Consider that room stay is NOT inexpensive in this hotel internet should be FREE, wireless, and in room!!! Still it would not preclude me staying there again. Excellent choice for cruise from San Pedro cruise terminal ( NOT Long Beach one ). Room service excellent as well for morning again reasonably priced as such things go. Coffee for two, bagel, fruit plate all excellent $20, Again for hotel room service reasonable. There is coffee pot in room to brew your first got to have cup and is breakfast in hotel restaurant downstairs. Didn't get price since didn't use. Ride to pier about 5 minutes! George in NY

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay but not the best location !”
Reviews.Author: Space_M0nkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel for a week. Nice bathroom and the bed is pretty soft - great for a good night sleep. The condition of the hotel is good. It is off a nice quiet location right by the marina, but it is away from the main "happening" area at 7th street. The food at the restaurant is pretty alright but I find it expensive. There are a few good eating places near the hotel though. Small fitness room but nice outdoor pool. I would not really stay here if I do not have business at the Marina or in the area. Other dislikes 1. No complimentary water 2. The offers high speed internet for $13 per day although there is complimentary wireless connection at the lobby. I find this expensive considering that I m paying more than $100 per night. Hint: Get a room near the lobby if you do not believe in paying for Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: revmary123
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights, before embarking on a cruise. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Double Tree has a shuttle service to port and to restaurants in San Pedro. Make sure you get a room overlooking the the marina, well worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again Amazing”
Reviews.Author: mjrdnx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel several years ago and loved the view and area. I booked this for a special occasion and was not disappointed. We overlooked the yacht club and had a balcony with outdoor seating. The restaurant was wonderful and had a great breakfast buffet with outdoor dining. I will definately make a return visit when I am in the area. Amazing room, view and food

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the location & price”
Reviews.Author: happyhappyhappy2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel prior to embarking our Princess cruise based on a trip advisor review. We are glad we did! We took a Super shuttle from LAX for about $28 plus tip, and then the hotel provided complimentary shuttle service to the port (although, we tipped the driver). Very easy. As far as the actual hotel, we were pleasantly surprised. Our room was at the end on the second floor. Really nice room, quiet, comfortable bed, Neutrogena products provided - which with 45 SPF - came in handy on our Mexican cruise. We ate breakfast, which was just okay, and then later had drinks, which were expensive, although perhaps not by LA standards. The hotel is in a marina, which was nice to walk around. We saw a dolphin, starfish and a ton of fish, so that was nice. There is also a nice walking area in the front of the hotel, providing good background for pictures. Another nice feature was that the hotel provided use of two computers with internet accessibility, sharing a printer near the hotel lobby. Staff was friendly, helpful, and competent. We truly enjoyed our stay at Doubletree in San Pedro. It comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great for pre-cruise adventure”
Reviews.Author: cruzincouple
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I chose the doubletree in San Pedro because we stayed at a Doubletree in Texas before our cruise out of Galvaston and enjoyed the experience. We decided to do a pre-cruise stay for our RCCL cruise leaving the 9th. We drove up from San diego and decided to make an outing of it and went to see the Aquarium of the pacific (outstanding! buy your tickets online and save $5.00 a person) and the surrounding marina area (also great). We also had lunch at a near by restaurant withing walking distance of the aquarium and the prices were reasonable.There are plenty of shops to see if you are into that and great areas for walking and lots of restaurants and you can get a good view of the Queen mary. Well we had a full afternoon and headed back to the hotel. We reserved the "park and cruise" package that included accomodations, parking for the week, champagne or cider and a breakfast buffett for two the following morning. Check in was quick and friendly and they gave us warm chocolate chip cookies which we saved for later. The front desk asked us to check in with the bell desk to arange for what time we would like to depart for the ship. The bell desk just asked what time we would like because they had scheduled times to depart and the just asked how many pieces of luggage that we had and said what time to meet in the lobby. That was it and took all of about two minutes. Our room was a king size non-smoking ground floor facing the marina which was very nice. The room was clean and was large enough. The bedding was crisp and clean and there were plenty of pillows. the bathroom had plenty of towels and the ammenities were neutrogena, including sunscreen (nice touch, for use on shore excursions) and face wash. We decide to walk around the marina and the hotel is next to a yacht club with plenty of nice boats, the grounds were well kept and we felt very safe in the area. When we returned to the room they had delivered the champagne on ice with glasses (more on that later). By that time it was time for dinner and you could eat at the hotel but we decide to ask the bell desk person what was in the area and he mentioned a good seafood restaurant. The hotel will shuttle you for free to places in the immediate area and then you just call up the number on the card the bellman gives you and they come and pick you up. It is a very nice service and my Wife and I enjoyed a nice dinner at the 22nd street pier (thanks Paul!!). What a perfect way to end a very full and enjoyable day. The bed was very comfortable and there was nothing that hampered a good nights sleep. In the morning after having coffee (Wolfgang pucks complimentary in the room) we decided to go to the buffett. I was not large but had just about everything you might want for breakfast and you could always order from the menu. They had hot and cold cereals, eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, muffins, juices, tea, coffee. We thought it was good and it was included in the package. By itself I think it was 18.00 per person, very convienient. Back to the champagne..we decided not to open it on arrival and instead make our own mimosas with some o.j. from the buffett. Another good memoy and nice way to get primed for a cruise ship departure! With the mimosas all gone we gathered our belongings and went to the lobby which is large and allows ample room for people to spread out with luggage etc. it is also a nice time to chat with other cruisers who are going to be on your ship. The shuttle driver loaded our luggage at the designated time and we were at the cruise ship terminal in about 10 minutes. the driver unloaded our luggage which went right to the cruise lines luggage handler and away we went to check in. Over all a very good pre-cruise adventure. Remember to keep an open mind when traveling and not to have too high of expectations but be informed and you might be pleasantly suprised more often than not. Check out our reviews on Cabo, Mazatlan, Puerto Vallarta and the rest of the cruise. Travel happy!!

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much more”
Reviews.Author: luv2gooften
Reviews.Content: Part of wedding party. Guarenteed a wedding party rate but had to negociate once we arrive. Front desk crew was very helpful and tried their best. Given room with a view and balcony as reserved. Discovered that the balcony was shared, but with no one from wedding party/family. View was marginal at best. Room okay but not up to Doubletree standards. Settled in for the night but was awakened early in the morning---discovered room was over the kitchen !!! Noise plus permeated with smell of bacon. Not a happy family member of the bride !!!! All this and the coffee was TERRIBLE How hard is it to make a good cup of coffee these days ????

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimmer727
Reviews.Content: WE flew in early for our Mexican Riviera Cruise on the Sapphire Princess. This was a absolutely wonderful hotel. We did book rooms with the Marina view- and it was great.
